q: Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.
h:
“Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.” —
Rumi

q: Failure is just information and an opportunity to change your course.
h:
“Failure is just information and an opportunity to change your course.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.
h:
“Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.
h:
“Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.” —
Denis Waitley

q: There exists only the present instant; a Now which always and without end is itself new.
h:
“There exists only the present instant; a Now which always and without end is itself new.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Grudges are for those who insist that they are owed something; forgiveness, however, is for those who are substantial enough to move on.
h:
“Grudges are for those who insist that they are owed something; forgiveness, however, is for those who are substantial enough to move on.” —
Criss Jami

q: When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.
h:
“When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Extraordinary results happen only when you give the best you have to become the best you can be at your most important work.
h:
“Extraordinary results happen only when you give the best you have to become the best you can be at your most important work.” —
Gary Keller

q: When you rise in the morning, form a resolution to make the day a happy one for a fellow creature.
h:
“When you rise in the morning, form a resolution to make the day a happy one for a fellow creature.” —
Sydney Smith

q: It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.
h:
“It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
h:
“A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Your success and happiness lie in you.
h:
“Your success and happiness lie in you.” —
Helen Keller

q: Do one thing every day that scares you.
h:
“Do one thing every day that scares you.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: When you realize you've made a mistake, take immediate steps to correct it.
h:
“When you realize you've made a mistake, take immediate steps to correct it.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Mastering others is strength, mastering yourself is true power.
h:
“Mastering others is strength, mastering yourself is true power.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.
h:
“Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.” —
Robin Sharma

q: People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.
h:
“People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.” —
Bob Dylan

q: There is no path to Love. Love is the path.
h:
“There is no path to Love. Love is the path.” —
Dan Millman

q: Whatever happens always happens on time.
h:
“Whatever happens always happens on time.” —
Zen Proverb

q: The quality of your life is the quality of your relationships.
h:
“The quality of your life is the quality of your relationships.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Art, like morality, consists of drawing the line somewhere.
h:
“Art, like morality, consists of drawing the line somewhere.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Where ever you are, you are one with the clouds and one with the sun and the stars you see. You are one with everything.
h:
“Where ever you are, you are one with the clouds and one with the sun and the stars you see. You are one with everything.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.
h:
“Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Maybe you are searching among the branches, for what only appears in the roots.
h:
“Maybe you are searching among the branches, for what only appears in the roots.” —
Rumi

q: Routine life is unbearable, and most people only think about how to escape into the world of fantasy and dreams.
h:
“Routine life is unbearable, and most people only think about how to escape into the world of fantasy and dreams.” —
Robert Greene

q: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
h:
“Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do.
h:
“Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.
h:
“Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Confidence comes from crossing thresholds.
h:
“Confidence comes from crossing thresholds.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.
h:
“If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: The greatest value of a picture is when it forces us to notice what we never expected to see.
h:
“The greatest value of a picture is when it forces us to notice what we never expected to see.” —
John Tukey

q: You came empty handed, and you will leave empty handed.
h:
“You came empty handed, and you will leave empty handed.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Some men see things as they are and ask why. Others dream things that never were and ask why not.
h:
“Some men see things as they are and ask why. Others dream things that never were and ask why not.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Embody what you teach, and teach only what you have embodied.
h:
“Embody what you teach, and teach only what you have embodied.” —
Dan Millman

q: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
h:
“Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.” —
Carl Jung

q: Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.
h:
“Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.
h:
“The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: To get angry is like to revenge yourself for the guilt of others.
h:
“To get angry is like to revenge yourself for the guilt of others.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Turn the pain into power.
h:
“Turn the pain into power.” —
Unknown

q: The biggest room in the world is the room for improvement.
h:
“The biggest room in the world is the room for improvement.” —
Unknown

q: Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.
h:
“Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.” —
Robin Sharma

q: If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.
h:
“If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.” —
Sun Tzu

q: The constant assertion of belief is an indication of fear.
h:
“The constant assertion of belief is an indication of fear.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: Don't allow your mind to tell your heart what to do. The mind gives up easily.
h:
“Don't allow your mind to tell your heart what to do. The mind gives up easily.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.
h:
“If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.” —
Criss Jami

q: It's what you do in the present that will redeem the past and thereby change the future.
h:
“It's what you do in the present that will redeem the past and thereby change the future.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
h:
“Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.” —
John Wooden

q: Any fool can paint a picture, but it takes a wise man to be able to sell it.
h:
“Any fool can paint a picture, but it takes a wise man to be able to sell it.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
h:
“Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: If you want to see things just as they are, then you yourself must practice just as you are.
h:
“If you want to see things just as they are, then you yourself must practice just as you are.” —
Dogen
